Check source code to identify parameter parts involved in the redirect. This helps to understand exactly what's being routed to the particular location when the option is selected.

Determine the nature of the value that follows &h= which is necessary to structure the URL for the redirect. Hashed values are typically generated by cryptographic algorithms such as dictionary hashing. This implies the use of an online MD5 hash-to-text converter needs to produce the originating plaintext value of the hash.
Launch the browser tamper data add-on to monitor the requests and responses.
Edit the URL by replacing the original destination website address with the desired one you want to redirect to. Make sure the &h= value is replaced with the hashed value of the new target URL.
